# main

**Type Property**

Returns the screen object representing the device’s screen.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor class var main: UIScreen { get }
```

## Return Value

The screen object for the device.

## Discussion

Apple discourages the use of this symbol. Use a [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIScreen] instance found through context instead. For example, reference the screen that displays a view through the [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIWindowScene/screen] property on the window scene managing the window containing the view.

## Deprecated properties

- **screens**: Returns an array containing all of the screens attached to the device.
- **applicationFrame**: The frame rectangle for the app window, measured in points.
- **focusedItem**: The item that is currently focused.
- **focusedView**: The view that is currently focused.
- **supportsFocus**: A Boolean value that indicates whether the screen supports focus-based inputs.
